result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus Lamont Hardwick

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcus Lamont Hardwick appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl appeared by video for Marcus Lamont Hardwick.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marcus Lamont Hardwick appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Christopher Ertl to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the conclusion of the case and then the 1st of each month there after.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court orders the $650.00 cash bail previously posted remain. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EJH.

Defendant Marcus Lamont Hardwick in court. Attorney Madaline Witte appeared for the State of Wisconsin under the student practice rule. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Skierawski, Branch 41. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/9/22 @ 2:30p
